result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Ashley M. Martorana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ashley M. Martorana is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ashley M. Martorana was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

SANCTIONS HEARING:
Defendant Ashley M. Martorana in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
14CF38 & 14CT34:
Atty Hendee states that this is a sanctions hearing for treatment court due to the defendant testing postive for THC.  Atty Hendee states that the team is requesting the court to lift the stay that was ordered and the defendant serve the 28 days jail forthwith.
Atty Peebles responds and asks for testimony.  

Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Hendee.  
Exhibit 1 marked by Atty Hendee.
Cross-examined by Atty Peebles.
Witness excused.

Atty Hendee offers Exhibit 1.
No objection by Atty Peebles.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit 1 received.

Ashley Martorana called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Peebles.
Cross-examined by Atty Hendee.
Witness excused.

Atty Hendee makes final arguments.
Atty Peebles makes final arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court will lift the stay that was ordered in 14CT34, Ct. 1:  Court orders 28 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence.  The defendant will have to have a clean UA before huber is permitted.
Report immediately, clean & sober
May transfer to Waushara County
Hearing at 03-12-2015 11:00 am
Review hearing on March 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Review hearing on February 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
TREATMENT COURT PLEA AGREEMENT

Defendant Ashley M. Martorana in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF38, 14CT34, 14TR819 & 14TR820:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 and Count 3 in 14CF38 and Count 1 in 14CT34.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  24 months with conditions on Ct. 1 in 14CF38.  All other counts to be dismissed along with the traffic tickets. Atty Hendee states that based on the agreement; the State will not file additional charges in 14-S01324.   Atty Hendee states that the defendant has been accepted into the Treatment Court Program.  Atty Peebles agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 3 in 14CF38 and Ct. 1 in 14CT34.  
Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 24 month DPA on Ct. 1 in 14CF38 with conditions.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Peebles makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  14CF38:  Ct. 1:  24 months DPA with conditions.
Court signs the DPA.

TREATMENT COURT:
Ct. 3:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; stayed for use of the Treatment Court team
Court Costs = $243.00
Comply with any counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Comply with the Treatment Court Program
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

14CT34:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 28 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before April 1, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to Waushara County
Pay fine and costs = $1,368.00
16 month DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
14TR819 & 14TR820 to be dismissed.

Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in March
Bond to be applied
Plea hearing on February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James D. Peebles in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Peebles states his client broke her leg and will not be here today.  Atty Hendee requests warrant with 1 week to produce.  Atty Peebles makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  Set for plea and remove jury trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on January 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Ashley M. Martorana in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Peebles states that there is possible resolution with consolidation with Waushara County.  Atty Peebles requests a Plea hearing before the trial date that is set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Return date on December 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ashley M. Martorana in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on October 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ashley M. Martorana in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF38, 14CT34, 14TR819 & 14TR820 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the parties have had much discussion regarding the defendant wanting to get into treatment court but the defendant has not had an assessment done yet.  Atty Hendee states that he was contacted from Atty Scott Blader from Waushara County regarding treatment court there and the interest she has shown in that county as well.
Atty Peebles agrees and states that the defendant will be possibly looking into consolidation with Waushara County's case and that the defendant wants to get into treatment court.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 25, 2014 at 11:45 am.
Jury trial on January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashley M. Martorana in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF38, 14CT34, 14TR819 & 14TR820:
Atty Hendee states that there has been talk about consolidation in Waushara County.  Atty Peebles agrees and states that he spoke with Ms. Martorana's Attorney in Waushara County and would ask that this be set out 30 - 60 days for a trial.

BY THE COURT:  Set for trial.
bond continued.

  Jury trial scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date on August 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

State files Information.  Atty Peebles received the Information and waives it's reading.  Not guilty plea entered as to each count.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant Ashley M Martorana in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives her preliminary hearing.  Court questions Atty Peebles.  Court questions defendant on her waiver of preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the defendants waiver and finds it is made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Return date scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 24, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ashley M Martorana in court with attorney James D Peebles.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF38, 14CT34, 14TR819 & 14TR820:
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Peebles states that he has not been appointed on 14CT34.  
Atty Peebles states that the defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim.  Time limits waived.

Atty Hendee states that bond has not been set for 14CT34 and asks that the bond from 14CF38 cover 14CT34.
Atty Peebles has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Bond in 14CF38 will cover 14CT34.

Atty Peebles enters a Not Guilty plea in 14CT34 and ask that it track with 14CF38.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.  
Track with 14CF38  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
D.A. DISCOVERY BILL
Adjourned initial appearance on June 23, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Ashley M Martorana in court.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that a warrant was issued for non-appearance at the last Initial Appearance but the defendant was in Jail and a new date was set.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant states that she does not qualify for PD and asks the court to appoint an Attorney.  Court states that the defendant will need to fill out the financial paperwork for a court appointed Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Adjourn to allow the defendant to fill out financial paperwork.

Back on the record with the defendant.
Court received the financial paperwork and approves to appoint an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Court appoints Attorney Jim Peebles
Payment plan: $50.00/month commencing in July
bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
